notes: First generation W202 (1993-2000). First C-Class model. C36 AMG features 3.6L V6. Diesel C220 available. Wagon variant introduced in 1996. Diesel requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz C-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation W124 (1984-1997). E-Class name adopted in 1993. 500E/E500 features hand-built 5.0L V8. Multiple diesel variants available. E320 4MATIC offers AWD. Diesel requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz E-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Third generation W210 (1995-2002). Four headlight design. E55 AMG features 5.4L V8 producing 349 hp. E320 4MATIC offers AWD. Wagon variant available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz E-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth generation W140 (1991-1998). Largest S-Class ever built. S600 features 6.0L V12. Double-pane windows. Complex hydraulic systems require specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz S-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth generation W220 (1998-2005). Introduced AIRMATIC air suspension. S55 AMG features 5.5L V8. 4MATIC AWD available. Advanced electronics require specialized diagnostics. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz S-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth generation R129 (1989-2001). SL500 features 5.0L V8, SL600 has 6.0L V12. Retractable hardtop. Roll-over protection system. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz SL-Class article, January 2025 revision.

First generation R170 (1996-2004). First SLK model with innovative retractable hardtop (Vario-roof). SLK230 features supercharged I4. Compact roadster design. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz SLK-Class article, January 2025 revision.

First generation W163 (1997-2005). First Mercedes SUV, built in Alabama. ML55 AMG features supercharged 5.4L V8 producing 342 hp. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz M-Class article, January 2025 revision.

First generation C208 (1997-2003). CLK55 AMG features 5.4L V8. Based on C-Class platform. Available in coupe and convertible variants. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz CLK-Class article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation C140 (1992-1998). CL500 features 5.0L V8, CL600 has 6.0L V12. Coupe variant of W140 S-Class. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz CL-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Third generation C215 (1999-2006). CL55 AMG features 5.5L V8, CL600 has 5.8L V12. Coupe variant of W220 S-Class. Advanced electronics. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz CL-Class article, January 2025 revision.
